feed.title: Probably Tech
feed.subtitle: Because every developer needs a blog right? Hello? Is there anybody out there?

entry.title: Time to Jekyll!
entry.content:
I’ve launched a GitHub hosted Jekyll site for myself using Octopress 3.0.

This will give me a handy spot to develop and post blogs, maintain project information that isn’t quite ready for publishing, and add a personal bookmarks page. I mainly chose this route because I like the idea of using source control for these things.

Eventually I’ll put up a post about how I set all of this up. For now, if you are interested, take a look at the Octopress 3.0 documentation. It’s a work in progress, but I felt like the instructions were fairly thorough.
entry.summary: I’ve launched a GitHub hosted Jekyll site for myself using Octopress 3.0.
